BestSoFar.framework.core

Class AbstractElement<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • BestSoFar.framework.core.AbstractElement<I,O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChildOf<Workflow<?,?>>, Deletable, EventuallyImmutable, Element<I,O>, Processor<I,O>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractWorkflowContainer

    public abstract class AbstractElement<I,O>
extends Object
implements Element<I,O>
    Abstract implementation of Element for elemental processors to extend, which requires a one-to-one mapping of input data to output data (without training necessary).

    Concrete Element implementations can derive from this to let it handle its parent Workflow, its TypeData, mutation management, and ElementObserver management).

      • discardNext

        public void discardNext()
        Description copied from interface: EventuallyImmutable
        Discards any replacement to this object and ensures this object is not deleted, therefore allowing for it to be replaced by another EventuallyImmutable object. In doing so, it makes the next version discard its previous version.
        Specified by:
        discardNext in interface EventuallyImmutable

      • discardPrevious

        public void discardPrevious()
        Description copied from interface: EventuallyImmutable
        Discard older versions of this, so they may be freed by the garbage collector. In doing so it makes the previous version discard its next version.
        Specified by:
        discardPrevious in interface EventuallyImmutable

        public abstract AbstractElement<I,O> createMutableClone()
        Description copied from interface: EventuallyImmutable
        Create a mutable clone of this object. It will remain mutable until passed as a replacement to replaceWith(replacement), at which point fixAsVersion(..) will be called to effect the change to an immutable object.

      • fixAsVersion

        public void fixAsVersion(VersionInfo versionInfo)
        Description copied from interface: EventuallyImmutable
        If this object is mutable, this method will make it immutable. In any case, it will save the new version information.

        Calling replaceWith(replacement) creates the new version information and passes it to replacement.beforeFixAsVersion(version).

        Specified by:
        fixAsVersion in interface EventuallyImmutable
        Parameters:
        versionInfo - the new version information for this object.

      • processCompletedTrainingBatch

        public CompletedTrainingBatch<I> processCompletedTrainingBatch(CompletedTrainingBatch<?> completedTrainingBatch)
        Description copied from interface: Processor
        This method is called after a training batch has been processed to completion, and returns a rolled-back version of the supplied CompletedTrainingBatch.

        The supplied completedTrainingBatch object contains the Mediator objects returned from the last call to processTrainingBatch(..), and which of those went on to be successful.

        "Rolling-back" means reverting these output Mediator<O> objects to input Mediator<I> objects, and correctly marking which of those went on to be successful.

        Processor objects containing multiple ways of processing the same input will have created multiple outputs per input, in which case this method must choose which output would have been created had the input been given to process(input). Only if this output was successful will its corresponding input mediator will be marked as successful.

        If this Processor needs training or optimising, this is the method to do it.

        If this Processor intends to train a classifier to be used in {Code process(input)} to select the best strategy for each individual input data, it is advisable to create a classifier for each input Mediator object's History object. This means that data that is created differently is classified differently.

        One approach would be to use a Map<History, Classifier> object that is queried in the process(input) method to get the appropriate Classifier for the given input.getHistory() object.

        It is left to the concrete class to decide whether to do this or not (eg. the training set per classifier would be larger by not doing this).

        Specified by:
        processCompletedTrainingBatch in interface Processor<I,O>
        Parameters:
        completedTrainingBatch - the completed training batch, containing the Mediator objects returned from the last call to processTrainingBatch(..), and which of those went on to be successful.
        Returns:
        the rolled-back CompletedTrainingBatch.
